node.contents: This will increase the heap not the permgen space, you need to set -XX:MaxPermSize

astNode.text: This will increase the heap not the permgen space, you need to set -XX:MaxPermSize

node.contents: Increase -vmargs to 512 & 1024 in eclipse.ini & close the eclipse & open it again.

astNode.text: Increase -vmargs to 512 & 1024 in eclipse.ini & close the eclipse & open it again.

node.contents: Hopefully it will solve the issue.

astNode.text: Hopefully it will solve the issue.

node.contents: Thanks man.I didn't set this in my Indigo and working fine.Don't know what's wrong with Kepler :). You made my day.

astNode.text: Thanks man.I didn't set this in my Indigo and working fine.Don't know what's wrong with Kepler :). You made my day.

node.contents: From Eclipse wiki-

astNode.text: From Eclipse wiki-

node.contents:
Why am I getting a java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space?

The default maximum Permanent Generation space set by your JRE may be too small. This is unrelated to the maximum allowed Heap space. You can increase the maximum PermGen size by launching Eclipse with the VM argument: -XX:MaxPermSize=128m

astNode.text:
Why am I getting a java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space?

The default maximum Permanent Generation space set by your JRE may be too small. This is unrelated to the maximum allowed Heap space. You can increase the maximum PermGen size by launching Eclipse with the VM argument: -XX:MaxPermSize=128m

node.contents: This problem might also be due to there being too many apps in the launch list when you Run As ... Run on Server in eclipse.

astNode.text: This problem might also be due to there being too many apps in the launch list when you Run As ... Run on Server in eclipse.

node.contents: To find out of this is the cause of the problem, you can just click Next to see the list of apps that will be launched, instead of rushing through to click Finish.

astNode.text: To find out of this is the cause of the problem, you can just click Next to see the list of apps that will be launched, instead of rushing through to click Finish.

node.contents: If you see other apps besides the one you want to launch, just remove all the unwanted apps so that only your app is selected, and then click Finish. This will require much less memory and thus not require you to jack up the PermGen space.

astNode.text: If you see other apps besides the one you want to launch, just remove all the unwanted apps so that only your app is selected, and then click Finish. This will require much less memory and thus not require you to jack up the PermGen space.
